reviewText:
This game is RAD. It uses the same engine as Commander Keen 4 AND greatly improves on it!

Gameplay is fantastic; Unlike Keen 4 you can take more than one hit [an improvement if i do say so myself] BUT on the flip side you can't save in the middle of a level. Well you CAN but if you load you're shoved back to the start with all enemies respawned and items gone.

The enemies are a mixtore of cute and rad, the dialogue give you a chuckle or two, and it has that kind of satisfying difficulty that is legit hard, not frustrating.

Also if you die, you're treated to one of my personal favorite death animations!

In short, this game is rad and you should play it.

reviewText: Best ♥♥♥♥in' era of platformers. Castlevania, Mario, Metroid on NES/SNES and Bio Menace, Commander Keen (id), Duke 1, 2, Hocus Pocus and other Apogee badassery on DOS, was a good time to be alive. I've always loved the complexity in the level design of Apogee's platformers, giving you large levels with verticality and multiple objectives to complete such as collecting keycards to gain access to locked doors, flicking switches to deactivate forcefields, collecting items/powerups which allow you access areas previously out of reach rather than being linear side/autoscrollers.\n\nLike most other Apogee platformers, Bio Menace remains one of my favourite games in the genre, it has Apogees trademark cheesy, tongue in cheek writing, badass interesting levels that are exploration heavy and have many puzzles/obstacles to overcome, secrets to find as well as tons of enemies to demolish in the process. It's also one of the more challenging Apogee games but regardless is still a blast to play. I'd kill for some of these games to get faithful reboot, there aren't enough platformers that take influence from the kind of design these games have. Enough with generic 2D sidescrollers, make something cool like these games ya boring ♥♥♥♥♥♥s!
voteText: 10 of 15 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Bio Menace is a pretty hard platformer starring everyone's dad from the 80's with acid-washed jeans and a mullet.  You will kill four million mutated enemies and reload your game four million and one times.  Actually, the first and second episodes are tough but pretty doable on normal difficulty, but the third episode is close enough to impossible that you might as well just round up and not play it at all.  Generally the level design and technical aspects of the game are solid, but there's a lot of cheap shot enemies and traps that kill you instantly.  That makes the long levels, infrequent checkpoints, and lack of mid-level save a frustrating mix.\n\nStill, for the first 2/3rds there's some decent platforming fun to be had that's only a notch below Duke Nukem and Commander Keen.  Just know when to quit.

reviewText: Bio Menace is too old to be worth playing if you weren't a PC gamer in the DOS era, but it has held up well enough that it's worth playing if it has nostalgia value for you. Load it up (now without having to worry about editing your config.sys file!) and enjoy the catchy Sound Blaster music, and the plentiful gibs that monsters explode into.\n\nOh yeah, and the guy's rockin' mullet.

reviewText:
First level - lots of enemies camping platforms right next to ladders. Unable to shoot from ladders. Too impatient to wait for them to walk away so that I can get on the platform and start shooting. Sometimes the platform is tiny and the monster just stands there, so I couldn't avoid taking a hit.

Jumping feels awkward. The character can shoot while falling, but not right after jumping.

Purple blobs aggro and have long-range jumping attack, combined with the character's fast movement, meant that on multiple occasions I'd run into an enemy with no time to react.

reviewText:
Want to go back to the past?

This game, Bio Menace. Is a piece of history made with ID Software's Commander Keen Engine, licensed to Apogee Software, and made somewhat single handedly by ONE FRICKIN' MAN!? (citation needed).

You take control of Snake Logan, yea most cliche-epic-soldier-name EVER!
With 3 episodes you are to save the world from the mutants created by a maniac, Cain.

The game itself is stylishly 8-bit and plays awesome and plays very good, and is enchanting.
Decent to discover secrets, and SUPER FRICKIN' DIFFICULT HARD MODE!
But if you are stuck, you can always cheat. Press down C - A - T on the keyboard at the same time, and you get full auto rifle and 99 grenades to kick more ♥♥♥♥!

Have Fun!
